ygData.subject: Farming and stuff
ygData.msgSnippet: ... cause the camping problem.  Your guildmates camped for their items, which I don t have a problem with, the continued FARMING to get items for guildmates,
ygData.messageBody:
Someone else said:
>I hate it when people get twinked out like you. Its people like you that
cause the camping >problem. Your guildmates camped for their items, which I
don't have a problem with, the >continued FARMING to get items for
guildmates, blah. I've never had a single magic item >given to me, I've been
there beside my guild buds working to get my items the whole >game......ok I
shut up now

Yeah, and I bet you also had to walk to school barefoot in the snow uphill
both ways, right? Look, regarding this whole "twinking" thing (a name I'd
not heard before I read this list), I think the ones complaining are the ones
who don't really understand the spirit of the game. They are the ones who
don't realize forming parties and guilds is encouraged, and that while
remaining solo might be fun sometimes, it just plain won't be as effective as
being part of a group. So then we have these soloists running about whining
about "farmers". My response to that is thus: big fat hairy deal. Norrath
is huge and up 24 hrs. a day. Go find some uninhabited area and start your
own farm. I have zero sympathy for someone whining about how he can't get a
tomahawk axe. Go and kill-steal one. If they were farming (and being rude
about it to boot), then they deserve to have a few kills stolen anyway.
